findings.message: Uninitialized variables are assigned with the types default value. Explicitly initializing a variable with its default value costs unnecessary gas.
findings.name: init-variables-with-default-value

findings.message: Using nested is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.
findings.name: use-nested-if

findings.message: Consider using the prefix decrement expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix decrement expression is cheaper in terms of gas.
findings.name: use-prefix-decrement-not-postfix

findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.
findings.name: use-short-revert-string
